name: Grand Wailea - A Waldorf Astoria Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand Wailea is a timeless oasis of 40 landscaped acres of paradise with 728 rooms and 52 suites! Just slow down: enjoy walks around the meticulously groomed property with abundance of flowers every where, waterfalls, koi ponds, bridges, stairways with koa wood rails, water fountains, statues, artwork, extensive 9 interconnected pools, soft sand beach, quaint chapel, spa & fitness center, activities, shops, torches glowing, palm trees swaying, etc. That's just the beginning, need more from a resort? Ok, clean spacious rooms with crisp sheets and plump bedding, luxurious bathrooms with walk in glass shower with super water pressure, deep soaking tub, large sink counter with separate commode room, amble closet space with safe, coffee/tea station with mini refrig and generous sized lanai with wood table and cushioned chairs. Do not believe there could be a bad view from any lanai, there is eye candy in every direction!
reviews.title: Opulent Grand Wailea Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Link: http://www.grandwailea.com/pdf/gwr_resort_map_453.pdf
reviews.title: Pure Paradise! Amazing Resort.

reviews.text: We had quick delicious room service on several occasions ie breakfast and dinner. Servers set up lanai table with table cloth and our order making our own private restaurant setting. Our meals were all as good as going into any restaurant! We ate at Humu Restaurant which we felt had excellent service, great food with a romantic atmosphere. There is nightly live Hawaiian music from 5 to 9:30pm at the gorgeous large open air Botero Bar near the lobby. There are several restaurants and bars with varying menus within the property. We enjoyed the GW pineapple refillable double drink container which is $22 for initial double tropical drink, yum, then $14 for refills. If it cracks, they will cheerfully replace your container and keep refilling for your entire stay! We tried many of their different tropical mixes, LOL.
reviews.title: Very grand and great pool/waterpark

reviews.text: We are not into the type A vacation any longer, where you get up at crack of dawn to run down to the poolS or beach. We never had a problem finding a chair or sunbather either at the pools or beach later in the day into evening for sunsets. We do like to drive out from the resort for sightseeing and shops, then return for the resort atmosphere. We took advantage of the paved long pathway that runs from the Fairmont Kai Lani on Polo Beach in one direction with breathtaking cliff drop off views to ocean, to past the Shops (& restaurants) of Wailea in the other direction offering other beaches and resorts! Wailea area has so much to offer in a laid back yet upscale relaxing environment.
reviews.title: kid heaven- but spendy!

reviews.text: From the time we pulled up in front of Grand Wailea's waterfall entrance, with cheerful quick valet, to an Aloha lei greeter who walked us to the check in lobby, we always experienced helpful cheery staff! GW's concierge staff called us back several times prior to our arrival with activity information and set up aptmts! Whatever we requested, our needs were met as quickly as possible with Aloha spirit! We do not feel the Grand Wailea could have provided any more than they do for their guests. We have vacationed at smaller boutique type resorts and have not experienced this level of cheerful service. Think it's all in one's expectation out of their vacation, but folks, you are on vacation, slow down and take in the atmosphere! But, most of all, realize you chose to experience a large resort with ALL it's amenities, expect a large amount of guests and give your servers some respect for trying to accommodate the numbers. Then everyone will enjoy the ride... The worse part of our stay at the Grand Wailea, was we had to leave and go back to reality!
reviews.title: Best Hotel Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent resort for all vacation travellers. Weather you are on a honeymoon like my husband and I or just a regualr vacation with your family. The resort is huge and has wonderful spots all over just to relax. The staff was super freindly and the food and drinks excellent. The best part was the pool with the many slides (big and small) and the grotto bar for the adults. Fantastic grounds and scenary.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Come to the grand and we will not be disappointed. The service is fantastic. True island paradise.
reviews.title: Step into paradise

reviews.text: If you are going to Maui, you might as well treat yourself and enjoy the best!
reviews.title: This resort is spectacular!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for an early wedding anniversary vacation. We used his HH points, which entitled us to a free stay (8 days/7 nights). We were not lucky enough to stay in the Napa tower, instead we had a ‘ocean view” blocked by some palm trees on the middle 5th floor. I forgot the name of the tower but it started with an H and it was the same tower as check in.
reviews.title: Early Anniversary Vacation

reviews.text: My overall impression of the room was that it was great for our needs. It was clean, it had a good amount of space and the bed was very nice.
reviews.title: Great business and vacation location

reviews.text: I've read most of the reviews in here before leaving and some are exactly on target. Now here's the skinny from our one week stay in September. I will kind of break it down into some categories.
reviews.title: Dirty room, soiled carpets, tired fabrics, way over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ARRIVAL. Excellent, timely, professional. It was better than arriving at most Ritz Carltons.
reviews.title: Paradise in Paradise

likes.liked: — Pool, beach, and grotto swim up bar

reviews.title: Grand Time at the Grand
reviews.text: VIEW. Excellent! For the first time in my life I got what was promised. Room 9080 was on the highest floor and we were in the center of the "U" shaped hotel complex. Yes, I agree that if you are on a lower floor, then you will have some palm trees blocking your water view. But the water is so far away, it really doesn't matter. Sitting on the balcony you could occasionally hear the ocean, but that's about it. Everything is drowned out by the man-made streams and fountains down below.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM. Filthy. I'm an engineer so lets talk observations and some form of empirical measurement. I walked around the bed in white socks and within about five minutes, the bottoms of my socks were filthy black. The carpeting was heavily soiled and in the week we stayed there, it was vacuumed once. The bedspread was threadbare and tired. The upholstry on the seats looked par for a Sanford & Son show. The floor on the balcony was also filthy.
reviews.title: Loved every minute of it!

reviews.text: HOUSEKEEPING. I travel a lot and have found that generous tipping up front usually guarantees my family will be treated well. I gave $100 to the housekeeping manager to be shared by those working my room. Nothing changed. In fact, it might have gotten worse. They come in, make the bed, change the towels, hit the tables tops a swipe or two, empty the trash and hit the trail. It's probably the worst I've seen in any Hilton. The room was simply filthy.
reviews.title: Crowded, Costly, Constrcution at the beach, Convienent

likes.liked: — The pool, the food, the spa, closness to beach, and the artwork
likes.disliked: — The crowds......way to crowded. This is a large expensive property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a really nice stay in Hawaii so it's tough to complain, but I really strongly felt like I had to share the scope of our experience.
reviews.title: Great property, awesome spa, weak on service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds and rooms at the Grand Wailea were nice, and the pools are all amazing, which explains the fact that it was quite crowded with families soaking up the sun and fun. I don't mind a busy place and definitely felt like if we had our kids with us it would have been a great fit for us in that way so people should know that.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their Spa Grande was a unique and delightful experience for me. I had the Signature Treatment - when I normally always get a Deep Tissue- and this still fit the bill for me, which can be tough. The bathing tubs in the main room and varying hot/cold tubs were a novelty which I really enjoyed as well. I would highly recommend the Spa to anyone staying in the vicinity of this place, actually, for a day visit as it was wonderful. I should not however, my husband felt differently. His primary complaint was that his treatment room was well-lit, with open windows- through which he could hear all the kids screaming at the pool outside. He didn't like that. My room was well lit but I only heard birds chirping.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with exceptional spa

reviews.text: My one, big, issue was with service. When I'm staying at a nice place, paying nice-place rates- I want to feel like the staff cares, and I distinctly did not get that feeling at this hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely Paradise

reviews.text: The first day our flight landed early (which I think is common) so we asked the bellhop if we could leave our laptop bag with them while we wandered the grounds and ate lunch. She conceded but was clearly put-out by our request. That struck me as odd. We then proceeded to Bar Molikini for lunch where we waited...to be seen by the hostess, seated, to meet a waiter, to get food,... I chalked it up to being hungry and grumpy and ordered a glass of champagne with-instead of OJ- a splash of mango juice. The waiter acted like I was weird and I later received- just champagne. I drank it because hey, I like champagne. But that was odd to me too. Again, I chalked this all up to timing and me.
reviews.title: Fabulous trip.....no complaints from us.

reviews.text: Great for families with kids. Do not go if you want quite couples time. That is next door... This is about kids and their experience. Service is average. Watch out, they now force you to pay for parking on top of daily room rate and daily resort fee... Kind of over the top if you ask me.
reviews.title: Nice for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were at the Grand Wailea with another couple for three nights at the beginning of our trip to Hawaii and we were very pleased with the hotel.
reviews.title: Paradise within paradise

reviews.text: The staff there were very friendly and accommodating. There was confusion regarding our reservations in terms of how many individuals were in our hotel room and they handled it with the utmost of professionalism, making sure we all had breakfast included with our room and also waived the per person / per day resort fee. The staff at breakfast remembered us every morning and chatted with us like old friends.
reviews.title: Not what it used to be

reviews.text: The grounds are breathtakingly beautiful. The Grand Wailea obviously takes a lot of pride in making sure everything is perfectly manicured and landscaped. The pools are immaculate and the areas around the pools are also clean and inviting. I also liked that you had to get wrist-bands to get towels and use the pool areas; considering there are a lot of resorts in the Wailea area, I like that the Grand Wailea keeps a close eye on making sure that the people using the pool are registered hotel guests.
reviews.title: Amazing ground, pool and beaches but also other issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was also a pleasant surprise. The bathroom was huge and updated, and the bedroom itself was incredibly roomy, even for U.S. standards. We were upgraded to an ocean-view room and were not disappointed; it was lovely to watch the sunrise from our linai every morning! The room was clean and modern and they brought us extra towels, pillows and other amenities within minutes of calling the front desk. Plus, the beds were extremely comfortable!
reviews.title: More Wrong Than Right

reviews.text: My family last stayed at the Grand around 4 years ago. We go to locations all around the world, and have always compared our resort stays against the Grand. This year we decided to make the trip back to Hawaii (from Atlanta), specifically to stay at the Grand Wailea. We knew about the pool closing in advance so booked after construction was finished, so the pools were great. The grounds, and the Wailea coast is drop dead beautiful. Unfortunately, the service thru out our stay was lackluster to say the best. The checkin was awful (I have never experienced such terse hotel personnel at checkin), pool service was off/on, when the parking attendant thought I was a local he treated me like trash (although I parked a van there everyday paying my $20/day fee), pool security took our belongings off the chaises while we were swimming with the kids (something about leaving your chaises for 60 minute chaise policy?). It just did not have the same "feeling" regarding the service we experienced 4 years ago. I am not sure if the Hiltons managed this hotel back in 2004, but it speaks volumes when Paris visits she stays at the Four Seasons next door? and swims in the pools at the Grand? If just the service got better (someone needs to be fired)...the facilities in my point of view are still fantastic, and the coast of Wailea cannot be beat. The kids had a great time.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings?
Poor Service for the Price
reviews.text: This place is stunning, and absolutely massive. The service, however, was consistently poor for a hotel of this supposed quality. A rude waitress who forgot to order one companion's entree, and then delivered it 10 minutes after the others with no apology or comment. At Sunday brunch I was seated in the first seating to a filthy table including a stained, used napkin lying on my place mat. We had to request that the hostess clean it up, and despite the great spread of food, the waitress was pleasant but incompetent (for buffet service no less.) Save your money, stay elsewhere (or at the Four Seasons next door if you want quality service,) and just visit the place, act like you belong there and wander around. It's over the top, but worth seeing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for three days before Christmas 2008, and really loved our time there. It was one of the best experiences we've had at a hotel.
reviews.title: three days at the wailea

reviews.text: Now that said, this was the first time we'd ever stayed at an all-inclusive resort, but we've been in a number of nice hotels otherwise - so some of the features (and fees) which were surprises to us might be expected by others.
reviews.title: Definitively not worth it

likes.liked: — Everything is made to raise checkout bill. This claimed hotel class is far away to the reality.

reviews.title: Too Expensive
reviews.text: The pools/slides were teriffic, and fun for both kids and adults in denial that we're adults. Falling squarely in the latter camp, we had a ton of fun, and had no problem sharing the tarzan swing (for example) with kids twenty years younger than us. There is one 18+ pool, didn't spend a ton of time there, but overall the Wailea probably isn't the place for anyone seeking to avoid kids / families on their vacation.

The third time I have stayed there had a great time.Kids loved it we had two rooms in the Napua tower which I highly recommend Kids could go for breakfast on there own(Napua tower has its own common area where the serve breakfast ) and the food is good,saves a lot of time in the morning.Service is exellent,I should mention that I always tip,And I do not fell that the food was higher than any other high end resort lunch at volcano bar a resturant by the pool was about 120.00 130.00 for six people
reviews.title: Great Time

reviews.text: Myself and three of my kids did the dive class and ocean dive with the hotel scuba personal and they were great would highly recommend.
reviews.title: kids love grand wailea slides and beach

reviews.text: They are doing a lot of renovation by the pool but are only doing one section at a time and it really is not that intrusive all the slate is being replaced as some of it is older
reviews.title: Grand pools, but worn out room!

reviews.text: Would stay ther more often but its a long flight from the east coast
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.text: Great hotel for kids. Stay at Chapel or lagoon wings: they are closer to pool and beach. Food is good and expensive with numerous different choices. Rooms are big but not cozy nor luxurious. You will not be dissapointed but you expect a bit more after the astronomical rates you must pay; at least in february when i went. Best things are: its location: great weather (the northern part of the island is more rainny) and very nice beaches. Also an attractive mall at walking distance with different dining options. But ,in particular the hotel has an outstanding pool with lots of slides and other features and an excellent beach. It is my third time in Maui, the nicest island in Hawaii and I strongly recommend this hotel, if you can afford it.
reviews.title: Whales, turtles, and water slides!

likes.disliked: — Musty odor in the room - they all have it

reviews.text: I didnt stay at the hotel this time as the pool was being redone ( and I am glad I didnt). This is a case of " what used to be". It used to be thee place to stay and spa but not anymore. The hotel along with the spa is getting very tired. My Massage was great ( thanks Dawn) but that was about it.
reviews.title: Spa is getting very OLD
Grand Wailea on Maui remains my family's favorite hotel
reviews.text: I have gone to Hawaii with my wife and family several times, and we've been fortunate to have traveled over the years with my now teenage kids to some nice hotels, but The Grand Wailea on Maui remains my family's favorite hotel. The service was the best we've ever had anywhere, the hotel is beautiful and the beach was excellent. It's just a great spot. My only minor complaint is that the gym is relatively small - it does have 2 rooms but I found it a little claustrophobic. If you go, either stay on the floor that offers breakfast on your floor - Napua? - or try one of the residences just off the hotel's main property if you need a kitchen; my friends did this and said it was great and cost effective. By comparsion, we went The Grand Hyatt on Kauai a year or two ago and we did not like it. It was too man made, too fake and they did not have beach chairs on the beach, which was a huge drawback.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first two times I visited this resort it was fabulous !! The grounds were painstakingly well kept and all of the sculptures and bronze statues were polished. The food was good ,although
reviews.title: The Grand Wailea has lost it's Cachet

likes.disliked: — Too expensive for what you are getting.

reviews.title: Beautiful property, service was dismal
reviews.text: somewhat high at the time.
I visited again right after Thanksgiving for 7 days and what a change !!! The grounds did not seem to be nearly as well cared for. A wood railing in the garden was broken with "caution" tape
reviews.title: Grand Wailea was Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I used our Hilton Honor Points and redeemed for a 6-nights stay, from 01/29/09 to 02/04/09. We have stayed at numerous Hiltons and Conrads, but this is the first (and most likely last) time we will be staying in a Waldorf Astoria property. I would not have paid half of the rates posted to stay at this resort.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

likes.liked: — The linens on the bed is great.
likes.disliked: — Nickel and diming us to death.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of my personal disappointments:
reviews.title: Loved this Resort

likes.liked: — The cleanliness, amazing grounds/beach, and rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The front desk first offered me an "ocean view" room. However, when we entered the room, the view, if any, was COMPLETELY blocked by the foliage of a big tree. After we went back to the front desk to complain, they then changed us to an "above the tree line" room with views of the ocean. Mind you, the property is NOT FULL and I do not understand why they'd want to put customers in less desirable rooms in the first place when there are plenty of others vacant?
reviews.title: Wow! Best place EVER!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The hotel charges for EVERYTHING. From $250/day for a large canopy (which is 95% vacant everyday, since no one in today's economy would want to shell out that kind of money for shade), to $50/day for a smaller two-persons lounger, to $25 to clean out the in-room fridge for us to put our own drinks in there, to $25/day resort fee (which by the way, should cover those shaded canopies in the first place).
reviews.title: Restaurant just too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Hilton Honors Gold and Diamond members be aware, none of your normal loyalty perks is applicable here. We did not receive any breakfast, newspaper or spa passes. Oh, we did receive one bottle of Evian on the first day and they did offer us a $40 food coupon which is a joke because of all the restrictions it comes with, like it is only valid at the 3 most expensive restarurants on-site and only for dinner. I could eat like a king for 1/2 the money down the street at Cafe O'Lei. Oh, they did offer to upgrade us to their "Napua Lounge" for just $200 more per day... they must think we are stupid or something!
reviews.title: Simply fantastic!

likes.liked: — The beautiful location, luxurious grounds, and amazing attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best resort that I've ever stayed at. With that said, there were some minor hiccups, but I would recommend in an instant. We got a killer price per night, so that made our trip even better. It looks as if timing is everything according to the reviews. We stayed at the end of April/early May ... no problems with noisy kids or crowds.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Maui. Wanted to give a 5, but 4.5 is more accurate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here are my pros and cons:
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Averag Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful lobby and lovely grounds; great pools; spacious rooms with nice amenities and oh so quiet; friendly and courteous staff; fitness center that was the best I've been to on a hotel property; fantastic meal at Amasia; nice beach area; adult pool was a bonus; close proximity to airport and Lahaina.
reviews.title: Service with Aloha!

reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Incredible- The Best Resort in Maui
Big bucks in paradise
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for six nights, July 28-August 3. This was our second visit to this property, the first being in January 2005. We are in our early 40s and we did not bring children.

Overview: The Grand Wailea is a Hilton-owned hotel (as of August 1, 2006) located in the Wailea resort area on southwest Maui, which is the sunniest part -- and hence the most expensive part -- of Maui. The hotel is approximately 30-40 minutes from the Kahului airport; it is just outside the town of Kihei. Renting a car at the airport is a necessity as there is no “shuttle” service or public transportation to the resort area.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with some ups and downs

reviews.text: Price/Value: We paid $656/night for a “full ocean view“ room, this being the high-season rate. It is difficult to make a distinction, however, between the “full“ and “partial” ocean view rooms in that most rooms are set back several hundred feet from the beach and are to some degree blocked by palm trees. Our supposed full-ocean view room only obliquely viewed the ocean. To see the ocean required standing outside the room on the left side of the patio: “Ah, THERE’S the ocean!” In our opinion, there are very few genuine “full” ocean view rooms -- as in dead-on, sight unobstructed views of the ocean.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, but the pool is stuck in the 1980's

reviews.text: Upon check-in we were delighted to find out that we had been upgraded to a Napua Tower room, which is closed off from the other floors by a card-activated gate and includes complimentary continental breakfast (eggs, breads, and fruit, no meat) each morning and a complimentary (!) “happy hour” in the evening.
reviews.title: Didn't really dig it!

likes.disliked: — Customer service and overall feeling of snobbiness

reviews.text: Additional charges include valet parking of $15/day and a “resort fee” of $20/day. Taxes ran about 4.5%.
reviews.title: Absolutely LOVED Grand Wailea!!!

likes.liked: — Great rooms with best view ever

reviews.text: I was there in Grand Wailea for 4 days during second week of June. It was a wonderful experience. Hotel has nice landscapes and beautiful views of ocean and the sun set was really wonderful. Hotel facilities were also excellent. The beach was very clean and enjoyable. Overall a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with world class amenities

reviews.text: I just got back from a week at the Grand Wailea. My experience with the hotel couldn't have been better. I was greeted with a beautiful lei upon arrival. The staff was always friendly and accomodating. When Valet brought my car, I was always furnished cold water and was always asked if I needed directions. The grounds are immaculate and breathtaking. I can't imagine any hotel ever topping my experience at the Grand Wailea.
reviews.title: Wonderful trip to Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My bed was turned down nightly with a flower and a good-night card.
reviews.title: Grand Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I overbooked myself with tours. Next time I believe I could spend the entire week at the GW.
reviews.title: Paradise with a price

reviews.text: Pam K
reviews.title: Worst Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a couple in our late 20s without children who stayed at the Grand Wailea in mid-September. Like other reviewers have said, we were skeptical after reading other reviews and almost changed our reservation to another hotel at the last minute. We're so glad we didn't! We are used to staying at 4 and 5 star hotels, and the Grand Wailea met all of our expectations.
reviews.title: We loved it and will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were large and clean. We had a deluxe ocean view king, and it provided a great view of the ocean and the resort grounds and chapel. The carpet in the room looked new to us. Bathrooms were large with a shower and separate soaking tub. The bed was cozy with a down mattress topper and white duvets. Our room was serviced twice a day. Yes, the rooms may need a little updating sometime soon, but they are definitely not in disrepair.
reviews.title: 25 year anniversary in paradise

reviews.text: The pool area was fantastic. You don't have to have kids to enjoy all the fun water slides and rapids! We usually sat at the adults-only pool, which had a great view towards the ocean and was always peaceful. Poolside service was always available and always friendly. Chairs were always available, but we rented a cabana twice and thoroughly enjoyed it. Other reviewers have complained about missing pool tiles. Yes, I did see a few missing tiles, but I don't think I would've noticed them had I not read the reviews here! Don't worry -- everything looks beautiful.
reviews.title: My Turn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only ate breakfast at the hotel one morning. We had the buffet and found it to be just okay. We highly recommend dinner at Ferraro's next door at the Four Seasons. We ate there twice and the food and the atmosphere are incredible!
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we were very happy with our stay and will definitely stay again when we return to Maui.
reviews.title: Two Yuppies- No Kids

reviews.text: A great resort. The restaurants, room, service and location were all excellent. The pool is fantastic. A great experience.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: We stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend and loved it. We have two girls ages 5 & 8 who were are spoiling by taking them to these places by the wife and I love the Resorts. The hotel is GRAND. Lots of families and kids and next to the Shops at Wailea. I recommend making reservations at restaurants in the Shops at Wailea as we always seem to have to wait when we go there. We had a great view and ambiance at Humumhunukunukuapua'a which is an ocean view restaurant in the Grand Wailea. The name is for Hawaii's state fish which supposedly makes a pig noise outside the water.
reviews.title: Great for kids

reviews.text: The pools were awesome. Several different sized water slides, swim up bar, cave, water elevator etc... It was extremely crowded with families but it was ok since I was one of them. You had to get to the pool early to get a good seat location. The food at the pool is way overpriced for the quality. We usually layed on loungers at the beach which is very large and suprisingly not crowded. Its just steps away from the pool so we didn't bother fighting for chairs by the pool. We had a 9th floor room facing the Four Seasons which produced an awesome sunset this time of year.
reviews.title: Great pool, Great Resort

reviews.text: The room was not a suite and it was large with a nice balcony and large bathroom.
reviews.title: Great for a birthday treat!

likes.liked: — The beautiful gardens and pools, the views, the beach
likes.disliked: — The furniture and carpets were getting worn and ratty looking

reviews.title: visited the hotel and was happy to be in the Fairmont
reviews.text: We loved it. Highly recommend. I rate a 9 out of 10.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited for two evenings in early October. The stay was widely shaped but the warm and welcoming front desk person that checked us in. I cannot remember his name as it was over a month ago - he was a wonderful Filipino gentleman that has been with the hotel for many years. Given our Hilton status, he upgraded us to one of the most gorgeous ocean front rooms we've ever seen. He threw in a number of extras as we were celebrating our anniversary and have a baby on the way. We actually decided to stay an extra evening thanks to his hospitality.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.text: We stayed at the Four Seasons for our honeymoon 5 years prior. We were nervous about the Grand Wailea because we thought it would be flooded with kids and not comfortable for a couple. We were pleasantly surprised. Luckily, the pool area is so vast that there is an area for everybody - an adult pool area (which they strictly enforced), a pretty beach area, and a large pool area full of waterfalls, slides, and the like (this area is well-maintained and clean minus the bathroom - yuck, that could use a bit more cleaning). It could have to do with the fact that we visited in October, but we never felt overwhelmed with kids. This sort of resort certainly attracts jerky adults (we had to move away from overly indulged businessmen on vacation a few times, and if you scroll down to the woman that refused to wear a wristband review, you'll get a sense of what I mean), but our enjoyment of the grounds, the outstanding customer service, and overall beauty of the property more than made up for a few sour apples.
reviews.title: Rude personnel

reviews.text: Our room was top-notch from the extremely comfrtbale bed linens to the highly luxurious bathroom. They skimped on nothing.
reviews.title: Expensive but Pool, beach and grounds are first class

reviews.text: We had a lovely dinner at the Humumumu (if I recall correctly) - great service althought the food was standard hotel food - nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Never a bad stay

reviews.text: We look forward to returning with our child in the near future. The Grand Wailea is well worth every penny.
reviews.title: Nice Romantic Resort

reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for 6 nights and stayed in an ocean view room in the Chapel Wing. The room overlooked the small chapel at the hotel where weddings take place. It is surrounded by a pond with giant fish that my kids loved to feed. We could also see some of the ocean. The gardens of the hotel are the highlight as they obviously spared no expense in landscaping the grounds. The hotel is a masterpiece. The open air lobby is magnificent and the fitness center is the nicest I have ever seen in a hotel. The problem is you pay a heavy price to stay here and I am not sure it is worth it. We booked our room through an opthalmology meeting that was there in order to get a meeting rate. We still paid 400 dollars a night, plus multiple fees were added on including an 18 dollar a day "resort fee" supposedly to cover our access to the swimming pools and fitness center. The food and drink prices are prohibitively expensive. They charged my children 8 dollars each for a frozen lemonade at the pool restaurant. A minimal lunch for 3 was over 70 dollars (at the pool). We ended up eating every meal at restaurants in Kihei. They even charged us 25 dollars to rent a small fridge for the week as the rooms have a fridge, but it is full of high priced snacks and drinks and is locked unless you opt for the "self service bar" option. The rooms were nice, but not exceptional for the price. The swimming pools were so cold that it was unpleasant to swim in them. There were no organized pool activities and no drink service at the pools. The beach was great and well maintained. The staff was pleasant but not overly friendly. The nicest person I met there was the maid for our room. They did respond quickly when or toilet clogged. The whole place had an air of pretentiousness about it. I think the only people who can afford it are foreigners who's currency is strong against the dollar. I struggled daily to find a parking place big enough for my rented minivan in the under sized self park garage that was quite a hike to my room. The garage by the front of the hotel is valet parking only. When I return to Maui I will stay somewhere more reasonable as the main attraction to the Grand Wailea is the many pools and its location. I think there are other hotels that would offer the same for less.
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel but Worth the Price?

likes.liked: — The great beach at the hotel.
likes.disliked: — The outrageous prices and the sense of being nickled and dimed to death.

reviews.title: Overpriced and average at best.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for a conference that was being held here. Fortunately, we received a discounted rate because of the conference. I read some of the reviews before we went and I agree with the majority of them. The resort really charges for every little thing. They charge $25.00 daily as a resort fee. However, if you want to use an umbrella on the beach or sit by a covered area by the the pool you have to rent the umbrella for $35.00/day or pay $50.00 to sit under a covered chair. I would think that should be included as part of the resort fee. We all found this to be incredilbly tacky. In most resorts umbrellas are available on a first come first serve basis. Most of our friends found ourselves sitting on the grassy lawn which had numerous flies but happened to have shade because none of us could stomach the exorbitant umbrella fees. In general, there seemed to be a charge for every little thing and prices were excessive. The service and the people who work here were cordial and friendly but that doesn't compensate for the the excessive prices and poor policies the hotel operates under.
My wife and I have been coming back to this hotel for the past 10 years. We love it. You will not find a hotel with more beautiful grounds than the Grand Wailea anywhere on Maui.
reviews.title: We love this hotel !! Here is what you need to know about the Grand.

reviews.text: The Four Seasons next door is a great hotel also. I see people make comparrisons on this website all the time. Yes... the service is better at the Four Seasons. Will you have problems occasionally at the Grand Wailea..... Yes you might. But you can't take it personal. I know these hotels are expensive, but things will not always go perfectly. The Grand Wailea is a huge hotel. It takes tremendous manpower to run it and I think they do a great job. If there is a problem, go to one of the managers and they will try to make it right.
reviews.title: Spa with coachroach! Rude Management, Poor service!

reviews.text: There are a lot of kids at the Grand Wailea, that is because they have a great pool system. The pools are awesome!! I am in my early 40's and still look forward to coming back so I can enjoy the slides... lazy river etc.
reviews.title: Spa w/ Cockroach! Poor Managment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea the first week of May.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: We booked using Hilton Honors points which only guarantees the most basic room. At check-in we were upgraded to an ocean view room in the lagoon tower. We liked the location as it was closest to the beach, pool and restaurants. The room was large with a very big bathroom and nice sized lanai. There was some visible wear and tear but everything was very clean during our stay. You could see the ocean so I guess that qualifies as ocean view, but it was over the pool complex and through a maze of palm tree. I would have been disappointed had we’d paid extra for the view.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property....however....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don’t go to Hawaii to hang out at the pool so we didn’t spend much time there. We did notice the chair squatting started early but we never had a problem finding chairs later in the afternoon for an hour or two.
reviews.title: Can't Wait To Go Back Next Year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach in front of the hotel is excellent as are others nearby.
reviews.title: Amazing place!

reviews.text: We ate at Humu one night and it was very good. It was pricey but consistent with other high end restaurants in Wailea. Unfortunately Bistro Molokini was closed for dinner during our entire stay. This is the pool restaurant/casual dinner option. The menu looked good and less expensive than Humu. The café was a complete ripoff so we never ate a full meal there but the quality of the baked goods and such was unimpressive. There are numerous dining options within 10 minutes, both casual and upscale.
reviews.title: LOVED IT!!!!!

reviews.text: This is a five star Hotel with a five srar price. The grounds are amazing, and a few good restaurants, but stay away from the quick service one by the shops, it's very expensive, and the food is not very good, although convient. Don't leave your pool lounge unattended for too long, the staff will pick up your items your items. It is walking distance to waiela shops. It also has a beautiful beach walk. The gym is first rate, but you do have to pay for the use.
reviews.title: Very high brow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea from 5/1 - 5/6 using HHonors points. Overall, the property is a nice one and has a great location in Wailea.
reviews.title: Decent Award Stay but Could Have Been Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in around 3PM on 5/1 without waiting too long. We are HH Diamond and received an upgrade to an ocean view room in the Chapel wing. We were on the 1st floor (there is a ground floor in this wing so we were elevated somewhat) and down toward the end of the wing which is close to the beach. I highly recommend the chapel wing and would suggest asking for a room ending in XX20 or less in order to get close to the beach. We were disappointed that they couldn't get us a king bed, even though we were Diamond and I had a king confirmed for our award room (although that wasn't oceanview).
reviews.title: Grand Wailea not so "Grand"

reviews.text: We also had a bit of an issue with ants - they kept invading our bathroom and no amount of raid seemed to keep them away (housekeeping came a few times to spray).
reviews.title: One of best places we've ever stayed

reviews.text: Rooms do have a fridge in them which is nice for keeping things cold.
reviews.title: Overall very good

reviews.text: Think twice...the check-in service is terrible from dropping your vehicle off at the front to waiting with your luggage for hours until your room is ready.
reviews.title: Nice place, service with poor attitude.

reviews.text: This hotel is great if you have children! So many activities. Great beaches. Two nice snorkeling reefs right on the beach at hotel. Great restaurants. The best Luau we have ever seen. Cool teen lounge with lots for the older kids to do. Pool, ping pong, tons of video games and also outside activities were offered for teens. The staff was wonderful and very attentive. even though the hotel was sold out our entire stay, it NEVER seemed to crowded or busy. Awesome art collections and great shopping a plus too!! Within walking distance of very nice shopping/ dining center. Played the Emerald course twice and loved it. The small adult pool area was nice and didn't feel like a set aside area but part of the resort. 5 star all the way!!
reviews.title: Like Disney on the beach

reviews.text: This was certainly one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever had the privilege of staying. The facilities, beaches, pools, concierge services and people were top notch. This would be the ideal hotel for a wedding, a honeymoon or a remote relax on the beach getaway . My experience at the hotel was wonderful and I recommend this property to you and your family.
reviews.title: The Most Beautiful Hawaii Resort Property - However

reviews.text: Now the however......If this is a location from which you want to explore Maui, see the sights; Lahaina/Kaanapali/Kapalua, the distance is significant. A winding (albeit pretty) road. If you like to drive, at night, dark unfamiliar roads, this would just the place to stay. Also, tried to find a restaurant open in the AM for a Bloody Mary and ended up having to go up to the Four Seasons restaurant. I was with a couple of active young adults so sedentary was not an option.
reviews.title: The best we've found in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, this is a great hotel. However you may want to factor into your deliberations what you want to do in Maui..
reviews.title: Beuatiful grounds , that it !

reviews.text: I've been to Maui a few times and usually stay at the Fairmont in Wailea. A few weeks ago, we decided to try the Grand Wailea since we heard it was the best hotel on the island. From the outside, the hotel looked very promising. The exterior was beautiful, the pools spectacular, and the beach access unbeatable.
reviews.title: Grand Wailea not so Grand
In need of room renovations!
reviews.text: But from the moment we pulled up to the valet, we realized that the hotel was simply a body without a soul. As we pulled up, we had to wait a minute or so before we were "greeted" by a valet. In fact, we had already unloaded our bags before one of the valets finally showed up. As we walked into the lobby, the female greeter uninterestedly placed leis (sp ?) around our necks. She didnt even bother smiling. I contrast this with the warmth and friendliness that greeted us everytime we arrived at the Fairmont. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 3:30pm, which is about half an hour past the official check in time. However, our room was still not available and we were asked to simply wander about the hotel and were told that we would get a call on our cell phone when our room was ready. Half an hour later we still had not received a call and decided to go back to the front desk. After waiting a somewhat lengthy time to finally speak to a front desk person, we were told that our room was ready. Where was that phone call?

When we got to our room, we were fairly unimpressed. The bathroom looked dated and the overall size was smaller than the rooms at the Fairmont. The pool area is truly the gem of this hotel. There are something like 10 pools and various slides and water attractions. However, if you're an adult, you might find the number of screaming kids a bit overwhelming. The hotel had a feel comparable to your average waterpark. Nevertheless, my friends and I still enjoyed the pool. The easy beach access was also a positive as it was just a few steps from the pool area.
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.text: My biggest complaint about the hotel is the service, or lack thereof. There was none of the island love, or general hospitality that you would expect from a 5 star resort, or more importantly a hotel that costs 500-900 bucks a night. The staff members rarely smiled, they seemed bothered when you approach them with a question, and generally seem out of place at a high-end resort. None of the little touches were found at the Grand Wailea.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Grand Wailea was magical

reviews.text: For example, at the Fairmont, smiling pool side employees would frequently walk around handing out fresh pineapples. At the Marriott Ihilani in Oahu, they had a jolly guy walking around the pool spritzing cool water on the feet of hotel guests. Those little things are so important when you pay the kind of rates you pay at the Grand Wailea.
reviews.title: Grand Wailea Awesome! $300-how?

likes.liked: — The awesome pools and waterslides, the views, the beach, the artwork
likes.disliked: — prices at the restaurants but we enjoyed eating elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand Wailea is a fantastic resort with an absolute best location on Maui. The resort grounds make it difficult to venture off the property. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable but do not deserve bragging rights; the carpet could use updating or periodic cleaning. The room views do not disappoint though. The pool and poolside activities are without rival; kids and adults will love the pool and not want to leave; for those 21 and older the Grotto is the place to be. The food and amenities are first rate, while the staff does all they can to see to it that you are enjoying yourself. Overall, the property is world class. However, world class comes at a very steep price. Be prepared for shocking prices, as noted in the other reviews. A modest breakfast for two adults will set you back $50 or so; drinks and snacks poolside could set you back $100; dinner is off the hook, $130 - $200 depending on where you go. Make no mistake that the prices you pay supports the fantastic grounds, pool, and service. I would give this resort a five except the prices put it out of reach for many families.
reviews.title: Fantastic property, a must see resort

reviews.text: The Grand Wailea was absolutely amazing! The drive to/from the airport is short but beautiful. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The spa is phenomenal with the different baths...great massage, mani/pedi and facial. Restaurants were great and there were a lot of nearby options at other hotels. The cave bar was a blast...not to mention the insane water slide. We spent most of the time on the grass - right between the pools and the beach so it was the best of both worlds. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We attended a luau and the food was great and entertainment was even better. Highly recommend the sunrise trip to Mt. Haleakala...breath taking! We drove along the coast to some of the nearby beaches and town and watch the surfers, stopped at a road juice stand and did some shopping. One of the best trips ever. When you think of paradise, Maui is it and Grand Wailea definitely helped make a perfect vacation.
reviews.title: Absolutley Fabulous!!

reviews.text: it is truly a beautiful property and we knew coming into it it would be pricey, but some of the prices are just ridiculous. Bagel- $13.00, cold cereal in $8.00. I don't care how wealthy you are - you feel taken advantage of. You must get to breakfast buffet before 8:00 a.m or forget it-and if you want a pool chair.......that is a whole different story. The pool and beach were so crowded it just takes all the fun out of it. I am so glad we stayed here but, I won't come back . We paid over 700 per night so a pool chair would have been nice.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: My husband and I got married here. It was an excellent experience but would we stay here again? No, we would stay at the Wailea Beach Villas right next door to this beautiful hotel. Don't get me wrong the hotel and grounds were amazing! The views were spectacular but we were disappointed when it came to the rooms themselves. We could hear the lady right above us walking around in high heels and a lot of people host various events here, which caused a lot of late night noise and the beds were way too soft for my back.
reviews.title: Grounds Were Beautiful But Rooms Were Nothing Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is great to come and enjoy the grounds for an event but for an actual stay I wouldn't recommend it especially for how much they charge a night. Meals were of course very pricey, but that was to be expected.
reviews.title: Picture perfect, lacks some warmth

reviews.text: Stayed for 10 days in July of 2010. Ocean suite in Napua Tower with concierge level access. Joined the membership club and was able to get better rooms because of member discount. The Waldorf Astoria is owned by Hilton. Both kids (11 and 18 at the time) enjoyed facility. The pool makes all of the difference for the kids. Ocean is so close you can choose to go in the ocean if you get bored with the pool. It's not an inexpensive vacation - but this is Hawaii!! Concierge helps with any tours or day trips and many are available. I think this is a much better location than the Four Seasons for families with children. Lots of stores and world class spa on site... this place really lives up to it's reputation and you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Family vacation in paridise

reviews.text: We just got back yesterday from a one week stay at The Grand Wailea. My husband and I took our 8 yr. old and 1 year old and had a very relaxing trip. There was something for everyone- overall great experience.
reviews.title: Grand Time at the Grand Wailea

reviews.text: Pros- pools were great, especially for an 8 year old. We went to Atlantis a few years ago and I was hoping for something with a little more "bling" like what we saw at Atlantis...but this was fine. By late afternoon my 8 year old was worn out and my husband and had a good time hanging out with the kids. The slides were calm enough we were able to take our 20 month old through the "circuit"...over and over. The beach was beautiful...and kept very clean. We went in "low season" and thus didn't have any trouble getting seats at the pool. This was definately time to go.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was plenty big. We were upgraded from a garden view to ocean view upon arrival. The bathroom was nice, marble, separate shower, 2 person soaker tub and toilet separate...nice touch when there are four people sharing a room.
reviews.title: Best of the Best

reviews.text: I didn't think the cost of things was too far out of line. (ok, most things) We had to pick up a few things at the shops and I didn't feel taken advantage of...sunscreen, an adult rash guard ect..I even found a 12.00 bottle of chilled wine...I wish I hadn't brought so much "stuff" along and had gotten what I needed when I got there. eg. rash guards for the kids.....they were the same price at Target as the ones at the pool store, swim noodle was only 5.00...I think I paid more at Target. Don't bother buying the stuff as people leave theirs at the pool and go home. Hit the pool in the evening or in the morning to find stuff people have left. (we left all of ours...lol)
reviews.title: Amazing resort greatly exceeding expectations.

reviews.text: My family stayed at the Grand Wailea the second week of October 2006. We had spent the first part of our vacation at the Hyatt Kaanapali and really liked it, but we were blown away by the Grand Wailea.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Grand Wailea

reviews.text: Upon arrival we were upgraded to a Napua Club Room, which is comparable to concierge level. Every evening we enjoyed complimentary hors d'oeuvres (crudite, crostini, etc.) and drinks (loved the planter's punch) and a delicious breakfast every morning, which included fruit, breakfast breads, and a hot item, such as eggs.
reviews.title: Fun place to stay!

likes.disliked: — All the extras are very expensive.

reviews.text: Our room in the Napua Tower was very spacious. The bath amenities smelled so tropical and great - my daughter brought them home and enjoyed "smelling like Hawaii" for a few days longer!
reviews.title: Thanksgving at GW

likes.disliked: — Not being able to rent a cabana

reviews.text: The grounds were immaculate and so beautiful. We loved strolling around in the morning and evenings and enjoying all the flowers and foliage.
reviews.title: Beware the reservations process.

reviews.text: The pools were great fun. I enjoyed perching on a ledge along the edge of the pool with a good book every morning to get some sun. My husband and daughter had all kinds of adventures on the waterslides and in the little hideaway cove areas. We had heard that sometimes it was necessary to get to the pool area early in order to secure a chair. This wasn't a problem for us at all, I guess since we were there at a slower time of year. We had our pick of chairs around 8:30 each morning, and even around noon there were desirable chairs available.
reviews.title: The most fabulous hotel in paradise!

likes.liked: — Beautiful surroundings, friendly staff, terrific pool and beach

reviews.text: My husband and I took our 15-month old daughter to the Grand Wailea -- mainly for the baby pool. We have stayed at the Kea Lani down the road before and I had enjoyed the spa at the Grand Wailea several times when I was staying elsewhere in Maui. We got exactly what we were expecting. It is a very large resort with grand and beautiful common areas and great pools. The spa is also wonderful and the staff, excluding the front desk, couldn't be more helpful and accomodating.
reviews.title: Great Bones, But Needs Updating

likes.disliked: — Condition of the rooms, front desk

reviews.text: The layout and architecture of the resort is still beautiful and the grounds are kept (for the most part) immaculate. The problem is that a luxury resort needs to keep their bedrooms and bathrooms updated and free of mold and rust. In addition, tiles, rugs and other common areas need to be refurbished often. This obviously hasn't happened at the Grand Wailea. The doors to the rooms are peeling paint and are scuffed horribly. I found mold spores on the ceiling of my bathroom, as well as rust spots where paint and/or wallpaper was peeling. The carpeting in the room corridors needs to be completely replaced. Not only is it old and outdated, but the dark blue pattern fights against the light tile work as the hallways give way to the outside areas. Some of the walkway areas also need work. In particular, some of the rock tiling in the walkways have chipped away and are uneven and unsightly.
reviews.title: Expensive, but Memorable

reviews.text: The Humuhumu restaurant was great and we enjoyed several dinners and drinks there. I cannot say the same for the breakfast buffet. Skip the bed and breakfast package and plan on ordering breakfast a la carte, which was much better than the meager offerings of the buffet (it pales in comparison to the Four Seasons).
reviews.title: Ex-pen-sive!!!

likes.liked: — Nice beach, pretty sunsets, polite bellman/valets
likes.disliked: — constant fees, herding, food, very little parking (must valet)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly, when we checked out we asked for a handful of documents to be FedEX'd to my husband's work (using our own FedEX billing number). The front desk person blanched and asked us if we had time to walk the 10 minutes down to the business center and do it ourselves. Not the response we expected or should expect from this caliber of a resort. I assume the $5 tip we gave him for his trouble helped ease his reluctance a bit, but it definitely left a lasting and bitter taste in our mouths. In the end, I don't know if we'll go back to the Wailea -- I would like to see it updated first and a genuine attempt to put a bit more "aloha" into the front desk (our check out was not the only hiccup -- when we checked in, the room was not ready until after 4:30 p.m. and they didn't care about (or apologize for) the delay). Also, even though it was not very busy when we arrived, the bellman forgot to give us our welcoming Leis. At the very least, they might want to think about sending some of the staff over to the Four Seasons to see how it should be done.
reviews.title: Love love love the Grand Wailea
Enjoyed it--but too pricey for my wallet
reviews.text: Resort Quality: Very High. This is a fantastic place but it is also Maui which has the highest standards and I think there may be better depending on what you are looking for. Great for families and kids, but Honeymooners should check out the Four Seasons next door (for extreme luxury) or the Hyatt in Kaanapali (for luxury but more 'fun' feel) with Lahina right next door.

aka: Grand Wailea - a Waldorf Astoria Hotel Wailea
description: Grand Wailea, A Waldorf Astoria Resort, is the ultimate destination for a fabulous Hawaii vacation, perfect for families, spa goers, honeymooners, golfers and active vacationers. Situated on 40 acres of lush, tropical Hawaiian gardens, Grand Wailea opens onto Maui's beautiful Wailea Beach, voted one of the best beaches in America, with elegant and newly-renovated accommodations, indulgent spa treatments, fine dining and thrilling recreational options.
